text.p: Comcast Corp said on Monday that Microsoft Corp has completed its $1 billion investment in Comcast, marking another of the software giant's forays into distributing multimedia programming.

Microsoft has acquired 24,642,681 shares of Class A special common stock at $20.29 per share for $500 million, and $500 million of a new issue of Comcast convertible preferred stock, Comcast said in a statement.

Comcast's convertible preferred has a 5.25 percent pay-in-kind dividend and will be initially convertible into 21,243,691 shares of Class A special common stock, which equals an initial conversion price of $23.54 per share, said Comcast, which owns cable and programming assets.
The issue has a final maturity of 20 years, but may be redeemed at Microsoft's option or called by Comcast after seven years, the company said.
Microsoft has made notable investments through its purchase of WebTV, which provides Internet access through television, and its venture with General Electric Co's NBC for the MSNBC network.
